Key Match Events: David Miller finished unbeaten on 59 off 46 as he saw South Africa over the line in their chase of a target of 134.
Lungi Ngidi's searing four-wicket haul and the efforts of the rest of the South African pacers meant that India were off to a disastrous start batting first.
Suryakumar Yadav's 68 off 40 balls almost single-handedly got India to 133/9.
Aiden Markram and Miller stemmed the flow of wickets after the powerplay.
Miller finally saw South Africa over the line with two balls to spare.
South Africa beat India by five wickets.
Miller smashes it over cover, the ball goes to the boundary that seals the win for South Africa.
Miller finishes unbeaten on 59 off 46 and South Africa go top of the Group 1 table.
Post-Match Reflections: Temba Bavuma commented on the team's strategy and performance, highlighting the importance of intent and momentum.
Rohit Sharma reflected on the pitch conditions and the team's fielding performance, acknowledging missed opportunities.
Lungi Ngidi expressed his excitement and nerves during the close match, attributing the win to his experience and observations from previous games.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The pitch had variable bounce which assisted the bowlers.
India lost their top spot in Group 1 after the defeat.
